> > Now you think it is not necessary that our framework supports 
> > Mock objects?
> Probably not.
> So you want to test your part of the code or the framework?
> If you want to test your part of the code, let your mock objects 
> implement the interfaces and extend the stubs (abstract classes) 
> of the framework. If you want to test the framework, replace the 
> JDBC parts by a mock implementation.

We use CMP and a Fast Lane Reader. But I think I have a clue now how 
to create Mock objects for our ERP framework. I'll try it that way.

What Mock solution would you choose? I read about EasyMock. Is it 
better then MockObjects?
